choices.A: Skip unused VIBs during boot up.
choices.D: Reboot and enable secure boot from the UEFI firmware interface.

discussion.content:
D would be ok, if UEFI wasnt turned on, on the hardware/bios. So, then i would choose C
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-vSphere/6.7/com.vmware.vsphere.security.doc/GUID-5D5EE0D1-2596-43D7-95C8-0B29733191D9.html
See Note

comments.content: I agree. It should be option C: https://kb.vmware.com/s/article/2147606

discussion.content:
Cannot be D
I would personnally recommend C

questions.question_text:
A VSS is configured with two uplinks and assigned a load balancing policy route based on virtual port ID.
What are two potential disadvantages of this configuration? (Choose two.)

choices.E: A VM with a single MAC address is limited to the speed of the uplink associated with the relevant port ID.
choices.B: The NIC with less load is more to be chosen if port IDs match.
choices.C: ESXi will use NIOC to attempt to migrate network congestion when an uplink becomes saturated.
choices.A: Higher resource consumption compared to other load balancing algorithms will occur.
choices.D: The virtual switch is unaware of uplink load and uplinks might become overloaded.

discussion.content:
most exam sites are saying cpu + data receive rate.
high cpu usage can cause bad networking

comments.content:
B and C are correct, we are speaking about a Networking issue.
"Packet capture can cause packet drops", yes but you can have very small packets that are not being dropped and this is causing big stress to the NIC. Is worst to have millions of small packets than hundreds of big packets (the performance will be much better).

discussion.content: Packet size would cause packet drops, hence C and D

questions.question_text:
A customer is experiencing a network performance problem and is using the esxtop utility to determine the cause. Esxtop reveals no dropped packets.
Which two conditions should the customer check? (Choose two.)

choices.A: vCenter HA requires an external Platform Services Controller.
choices.C: vCenter HA requires only an active and passive node.
choices.D: vCenter HA requires an active, passive, and witness node.

questions.question_text: How is vCenter HA different from vSphere HA?

discussion.content:
Must be: AD

ESXi can be installed in several ways. To ensure the best vSphere deployment, understand the options thoroughly before beginning the installation.

Interactive ESXi Installation
Interactive installations are recommended for small deployments of fewer than five hosts. 

Scripted ESXi Installation
Running a script is an efficient way to deploy multiple ESXi hosts with an unattended installation. 

Auto Deploy ESXi Installation
vSphere 5.x and vSphere 6.0 provide several ways to install ESXi with Auto Deploy. 

Customizing Installations with ESXi Image Builder CLI
You can use ESXi Image Builder CLI to create ESXi installation images with a customized set of updates, patches, and drivers.

questions.question_text: Which two options are available for a vSphere administrator to install ESXi on a host? (Choose two.)
